programme.title: Live Ford Super Sunday
programme.desc: Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.00pm). All the action from the Premier League clash at White Hart Lane, as Spurs look to maintain their title challenge. Spurs have impressed this season with their attacking brand of football that has also yielded positive results, and they'll be hoping young guns such as Harry Kane and Delle Alli can continue that form during the title run-in. Meanwhile, the Red Devils continue to fight for a place in the top four, which would belie some of the doom and gloom that has surrounded Old Trafford throughout the campaign.(n)

programme.title: The Masters - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the fourth day from the Augusta National in Georgia, as the opening Major of the year reaches a conclusion. Jordan Spieth started the final day four shots ahead of his nearest rival last year and showed no signs of any nerves affecting his game, eventually holding that advantage ahead of Phil Mickelson and Justin Rose, who were tied for second. Spieth also equalled the lowest 72-hole total for the Masters and set the record for the most birdies for the week.(n)

programme.title: FL72 Live
programme.sub-title: Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion.
programme.desc: Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Championship encounter, which takes place at the City Ground. Having started the season with an unbeaten run of 21 matches that reached into December, the Seagulls had seemed like certainties for automatic promotion to the Premier League, and while a subsequent loss of form following their first defeat placed that in jeopardy, they seem to have returned to winning ways at the right time. Forest appear to be in a state of flux, with Paul Williams serving as interim manager until the summer, and owner Fawaz Al Hasawi stating he would listen to offers for the club itself.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie introduces coverage of the Japanese Grand Prix from the Suzuka circuit. McLaren's Lewis Hamilton is a previous winner, although his victory came at the Fuji Speedway circuit in 2007. Last year he managed a third-place finish here, but it was Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel who took the honours ahead of Jarno Trulli. With Ferrari's Fernando Alonso another previous winner at this famously-demanding circuit, expect the competition to be fierce as the season nears its climax(n)

Jordan Spieth started the final day four shots ahead of his nearest rival last year and showed no signs of any nerves affecting his game, eventually holding that advantage ahead of Phil Mickelson and Justin Rose, who were tied for second. programme.title: I Signori del Calcio: Cannavaro
programme.desc: L'ex Pallone d'Oro Fabio Cannavaro ripercorre le fasi principali della propria carriera e fa il punto sui suoi progetti futuri. Nella meravigliosa cornice del golfo di Napoli, il campione del mondo 2006 parla del campionato italiano, della sua carriera da allenatore tra speranze e obiettivi, del Napoli di De Laurentiis e della grande stagione di Higuain e, infine, del sogno Nazionale(n)

programme.title: Empoli - Fiorentina (diretta)
programme.desc: Serie A. Anticipo 32a giornata. Gli azzurri di Giampaolo non vincono da 3 mesi nei quali hanno ottenuto 6 pareggi e 6 sconfitte. In casa hanno vinto una sola volta (1-0 nel 1986) negli 8 precedenti di A contro i viola, per il resto 3 pareggi e 4 sconfitte. La Fiorentina non vince da 5 giornate, a -7 dal terzo posto. Commento: Tecca-Onofri(n)

programme.title: Napoli - Verona (diretta)
programme.desc: Cod. 493084. Serie A. 32a giornata. Collegamento ore 14:45 con Sky Calcio Show. Azzurri reduci dal ko di Udine (3-1), ma restano l'unica squadra ancora imbattuta in casa in questo campionato. -6 dalla capolista. Verona reduce dalla prima vittoria in trasferta (0-1 a Bologna). -7 dalla salvezza. Il Verona non batte il Napoli al San Paolo in A dal 1983 (1-2), poi 2 punti in 12 partite. Commento: Gentile-Ambrosini(n)

programme.title: Roma - Bologna 11/04
programme.desc: Cod. 493040. Serie A. 32a giornata. Collegamento ore 20:00 con Prepartita. Giallorossi con 9 vittorie nelle ultime 10 giornate (1 pareggio). -4 punti dal Napoli. programme.desc: Cod. 493120. Serie A. 32a giornata. Collegamento ore 14:30 con Sky Calcio Show. Blucerchiati a quota 33 punti, +5 dalla terzultima. -17 punti rispetto alla scorsa stagione. programme.title: Como - Pro Vercelli (diretta)
programme.desc: Serie B. Posticipo 35a giornata. I lariani devono vincere per continuare a sperare nella salvezza. La Pro Vercelli e' a quota 38 punti, solo un punto sopra la zona playout. Telecronaca: Antonio Nucera(n)
